 Identifies local maxima for three given layers.

Detailed Description

Abstract class declaring an image.

All basis operations for building the SFOP scale space and detecting features are declared. The implementation, i.e. computations and memory management, are be done on CPU or GPU in derived classes like CImageCpu and CImageCl.

Building the scale space is devided into several intermediate steps intercepted by convolutions, i.e. integrating over some neighboring pixels. Detecting local maxima in one layer of the scale space is done the one function findLocalMax().

For reading image files or displaying results the library CImg is used. Therefore the class declaration of CImage is closely related to CImg<float>.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum SFOP::CImage::EFilterNames

Possible filter names.

Enumerator:
G 

Gaussian kernel.

Gx 

Derivative of Gaussian kernel.

xG 

Gaussian kernel multiplied with x.

x2G 

Gaussian kernel multiplied with x^2.

virtual CImage* SFOP::CImage::bestOmega ( const CImage *  f_omega0_p,
const CImage *  f_omega60_p,
const CImage *  f_omega120_p 
) const [pure virtual]

Compute best error sum from three error sums for a different * angle each.

The best error sum is defined as 

   omegaBest = a - b

with 

   a = 1/3 * (omega0 + omega60 + omega120)
   b = 2/3 * sqrt(omega0^2 + omega60^2 + omega120^2 - omega0 * omega60 - omega60 * omega120 - omega120 * omega0)
Parameters:
[in]f_omega0_pError sum for 0 degrees angle
[in]f_omega60_pError sum for 60 degrees angle
[in]f_omega120_pError sum for 120 degrees angle
Returns:
Best error sum

Implemented in SFOP::CImageCl, and SFOP::CImageCpu.

virtual void SFOP::CImage::findLocalMax ( std::list< CFeature > *  f_features_p,
const CImage *  f_below_p,
const CImage *  f_above_p,
const CImage *  f_lambda2_p,
const float  f_sigma,
const unsigned int  f_numLayers,
const unsigned int  f_factor 
) const [pure virtual]

Identifies local maxima for three given layers.

Identifies local maxima for three given images that are assumed to be stacked over each other in an equal distance. The maxima are calculated pixel-wise in a local neighborhood of size 3x3x3.

Parameters:
[in,out]f_features_pList of features
[in]f_below_pLayer below
[in]f_above_pLayer above
[in]f_lambda2_pImage with lambda2 values of current layer
[in]f_sigmaIntegration scale sigma of current layer w.r.t. downsampled image
[in]f_numLayersNumber of layers per octave
[in]f_factorScale factor >= 1 w.r.t. original image size

Implemented in SFOP::CImageCl, and SFOP::CImageCpu.

virtual CImage* SFOP::CImage::lambda2 ( const float  f_M,
const CImage *  f_Nxx_p,
const CImage *  f_Nxy_p,
const CImage *  f_Nyy_p 
) const [pure virtual]

Compute smaller eigenvalue of symmetrix matrix scaled by some factor M.

The scaled smaller eigenvalue lambda2 is defined as 

   lambda2 = M * (trace / 2 + sqrt(trace^2 / 4 - determinant))

with trace and determinant being 

   trace = Nxx + Nyy
   determinant = Nxx * Nyy - Nxy^2;
Parameters:
[in]f_MScale factor M
[in]f_Nxx_pUpper left element
[in]f_Nxy_pSecondary diagonal element
[in]f_Nyy_pLower right element
Returns:
Smaller eigenvalue scaled by M

Implemented in SFOP::CImageCl, and SFOP::CImageCpu.

virtual CImage* SFOP::CImage::precision ( const float  f_factor,
const CImage *  f_lambda2_p,
const CImage *  f_omega_p 
) const [pure virtual]

Compute precision from smaller eigenvalue, error sum and scaling factor.

The precision is defined as 

   precision = factor * lambda2 / omega
Parameters:
[in]f_factorScaling factor
[in]f_lambda2_pSmaller eigenvalue
[in]f_omega_pError sum
Returns:
Precision

Implemented in SFOP::CImageCl, and SFOP::CImageCpu.

virtual void SFOP::CImage::triSqr ( const CImage *  f_gx_p,
const CImage *  f_gy_p,
CImage *&  f_gx2_p,
CImage *&  f_gxy_p,
CImage *&  f_gy2_p 
) const [pure virtual]

Compute three squared gradients.

Parameters:
[in]f_gx_pGradient gx
[in]f_gy_pGradient gy
[out]f_gx2_pSquared gradient gx^2
[out]f_gxy_pSquared gradient gx * gy
[out]f_gy2_pSquared gradient gy^2

Implemented in SFOP::CImageCl, and SFOP::CImageCpu.

virtual void SFOP::CImage::triSqrAlpha ( const float  f_alpha,
const CImage *  f_gx_p,
const CImage *  f_gy_p,
CImage *&  f_gx2a_p,
CImage *&  f_2gxya_p,
CImage *&  f_gy2a_p 
) const [pure virtual]

Compute three rotated, squared gradients.

The rotated gradients are defined as 

   gxa =   gx * cos(alpha) + gy * sin(alpha)
   gya = - gx * sin(alpha) + gy * cos(alpha)
Parameters:
[in]f_alphaRotation angle
[in]f_gx_pGradient gx
[in]f_gy_pGradient gy
[out]f_gx2a_pSquare of first rotated gradient: gxa^2
[out]f_2gxya_pTwice the mixed product: 2 * gxa * gxy
[out]f_gy2a_pSquare of second rotated gradient: gya^2

Implemented in SFOP::CImageCl, and SFOP::CImageCpu.
